The event marked the culmination of the first season of The Ultimate Fighter reality series. The main event featured a bout between Diego Sanchez and Kenny Florian, with Sanchez emerging victorious. Notably, this event showcased the talent and potential of future UFC stars.

Title: The Ultimate Fighter: Team Edgar vs. Team Penn Finale
Description: The Ultimate Fighter: Team Edgar vs. Team Penn Finale was a mixed martial arts event held on July 6, 2014, at the Mandalay Bay Events Center in Las Vegas, Nevada. The event marked the culmination of the 19th season of The Ultimate Fighter reality series. The main event featured a featherweight bout between Frankie Edgar and B.J. Penn, two former UFC champions.

Title: The Ultimate Fighter: Team GSP vs. Team Koscheck Finale
Description: The Ultimate Fighter: Team GSP vs. Team Koscheck Finale was a mixed martial arts event held on December 4, 2010, at the Palms Casino Resort in Las Vegas, Nevada. The event marked the culmination of the twelfth season of The Ultimate Fighter reality series. The main event featured a welterweight bout between Jonathan Brookins and Michael Johnson, with Brookins emerging as the winner and becoming the season's lightweight winner.

Title: The Ultimate Fighter: Team Hughes vs. Team Franklin Finale
Description: The Ultimate Fighter: Team Hughes vs. Team Franklin Finale was a mixed martial arts event held on December 3, 2006, at the Hard Rock Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas, Nevada. The event featured the finals of The Ultimate Fighter: Team Hughes vs. Team Franklin reality show, with Roger Huerta defeating Clay Guida in an epic lightweight bout. Additionally, Matt Hughes defended his welterweight title against Georges St-Pierre in a highly anticipated rematch.

Title: The Ultimate Fighter: Team Hughes vs. Team Serra Finale
Description: The Ultimate Fighter: Team Hughes vs. Team Serra Finale was a mixed martial arts event held on December 8, 2007, at the Palms Casino Resort in Las Vegas, Nevada. The event marked the culmination of the sixth season of The Ultimate Fighter reality series. The main event featured a welterweight bout between Mac Danzig and Tommy Speer, with Danzig emerging as the winner. Notably, this event also showcased the finals of the lightweight and welterweight divisions of the reality show.

Title: The Ultimate Fighter: Team Joanna vs. Team Cláudia Finale
Description: The Ultimate Fighter: Team Joanna vs. Team Cláudia Finale was a mixed martial arts event held on July 8, 2016, at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas, Nevada. The event featured the finals of The Ultimate Fighter: Team Joanna vs. Team Cláudia reality show, where Tatiana Suarez and Andrew Sanchez emerged as the winners. The main event showcased a strawweight bout between Joanna Jędrzejczyk and Cláudia Gadelha.

Title: The Ultimate Fighter: Team Jones vs. Team Sonnen Finale
Description: The Ultimate Fighter: Team Jones vs. Team Sonnen Finale was a mixed martial arts event held on April 13, 2013, at the Mandalay Bay Events Center in Las Vegas, Nevada. The event marked the culmination of the seventeenth season of The Ultimate Fighter reality series. The main event featured a bout between Urijah Faber and Scott Jorgensen, while the co-main event showcased Kelvin Gastelum against Uriah Hall.

Title: The Ultimate Fighter: Team Lesnar vs. Team dos Santos Finale
Description: The Ultimate Fighter: Team Lesnar vs. Team dos Santos Finale was a mixed martial arts event held on June 4, 2011, at the Palms Casino Resort in Las Vegas, Nevada. The event marked the culmination of the 13th season of The Ultimate Fighter reality series. The main event featured a heavyweight bout between Clay Guida and Anthony Pettis, with Pettis winning via unanimous decision.

Title: The Ultimate Fighter: Team Liddell vs. Team Ortiz Finale
Description: The Ultimate Fighter: Team Liddell vs. Team Ortiz Finale was a mixed martial arts event held on June 19, 2010, at the Pearl at the Palms in Las Vegas, Nevada. The event marked the culmination of the eleventh season of The Ultimate Fighter reality series. The main event featured a bout between Court McGee and Kris McCray, with McGee emerging as the winner and becoming the season's middleweight champion.

Title: The Ultimate Fighter: Team McGregor vs. Team Faber Finale
Description: The Ultimate Fighter: Team McGregor vs. Team Faber Finale was a mixed martial arts event held on December 11, 2015, at The Chelsea at The Cosmopolitan in Las Vegas, Nevada. The event featured the finals of The Ultimate Fighter: Team McGregor vs. Team Faber, with Ryan Hall winning the lightweight division and Tatiana Suarez winning the women's strawweight division. The event also showcased a highly anticipated featherweight bout between Frankie Edgar and Chad Mendes.

Title: The Ultimate Fighter: Team Nogueira vs. Team Mir Finale
Description: The Ultimate Fighter: Team Nogueira vs. Team Mir Finale was a mixed martial arts event held on December 13, 2008, at the Palms Casino Resort in Las Vegas, Nevada. The event marked the culmination of the eighth season of The Ultimate Fighter reality series. The main event featured a lightweight bout between Efrain Escudero and Phillipe Nover, with Escudero emerging victorious via unanimous decision.

Title: The Ultimate Fighter: Team Ortiz vs. Team Shamrock Finale
Description: The Ultimate Fighter: Team Ortiz vs. Team Shamrock Finale was a mixed martial arts event held on April 9, 2006, at the Hard Rock Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas, Nevada. The event marked the culmination of the third season of The Ultimate Fighter reality series. The main event featured a bout between Tito Ortiz and Ken Shamrock, serving as coaches for the competing teams.

Title: The Ultimate Fighter: Team Pulver vs. Team Penn Finale
Description: The Ultimate Fighter: Team Pulver vs. Team Penn Finale was a mixed martial arts event held on June 23, 2007, at The Pearl at the Palms in Las Vegas, Nevada. The event marked the culmination of the fifth season of The Ultimate Fighter reality series. The main event featured a lightweight bout between Nate Diaz and Manny Gamburyan, with Diaz emerging victorious via submission.

Title: The Ultimate Fighter: Team Rampage vs. Team Forrest Finale
Description: The Ultimate Fighter: Team Rampage vs. Team Forrest Finale was a mixed martial arts event held on December 13, 2008, at The Pearl at the Palms in Las Vegas, Nevada. The event marked the culmination of the seventh season of The Ultimate Fighter reality series. The main event featured a lightweight bout between Diego Sanchez and Joe Stevenson, with Sanchez emerging victorious via unanimous decision.

Title: The Ultimate Fighter: Team Rousey vs. Team Tate Finale
Description: The Ultimate Fighter: Team Rousey vs. Team Tate Finale was a mixed martial arts event held on November 30, 2013, at the Mandalay Bay Events Center in Las Vegas, Nevada. The event marked the culmination of the 18th season of The Ultimate Fighter reality series. The main event featured a bantamweight bout between Chris Holdsworth and Davey Grant, with Holdsworth emerging as the winner.

Title: The Ultimate Fighter: The Comeback Finale
Description: The Ultimate Fighter: The Comeback Finale was a mixed martial arts event held on November 5, 2006, at the Hard Rock Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas, Nevada. The event marked the culmination of the fifth season of The Ultimate Fighter reality series. The main event featured a lightweight bout between Kenny Florian and Sam Stout, with Florian emerging victorious via unanimous decision. Notably, this event showcased the return of several fighters who had previously competed in the UFC.

Title: The Ultimate Fighter: Tournament of Champions Finale
Description: The Ultimate Fighter: Tournament of Champions Finale was a mixed martial arts event held on December 3, 2016, at the Palms Casino Resort in Las Vegas, Nevada. The event featured the finals of The Ultimate Fighter: Tournament of Champions, where flyweight fighters competed for a chance to become the inaugural UFC Flyweight Champion. The main event showcased a flyweight title fight between Demetrious Johnson and Tim Elliott.

Title: The Ultimate Fighter: Undefeated Finale
Description: The Ultimate Fighter: Undefeated Finale was a mixed martial arts event held on July 6, 2018, at the Pearl Theatre in Las Vegas, Nevada. The event featured the finale of The Ultimate Fighter: Undefeated season, where undefeated fighters competed for a UFC contract. The main event showcased a lightweight bout between Michael Trizano and Joe Giannetti, with Trizano emerging as the winner.

Title: The Ultimate Fighter: United States vs. United Kingdom Finale
Description: The Ultimate Fighter: United States vs. United Kingdom Finale was a mixed martial arts event held on June 20, 2009, at The Pearl at the Palms in Las Vegas, Nevada. The event featured the finals of The Ultimate Fighter: United States vs. United Kingdom reality show, with Ross Pearson defeating Andre Winner to become the lightweight winner and James Wilks defeating DaMarques Johnson to become the welterweight winner.

Title: Thomas & Mack Center
Description: The Thomas & Mack Center is a multi-purpose arena located in Paradise, Nevada, United States. It has hosted several UFC events, including UFC 33 in 2001, UFC 46 in 2004, and UFC 64 in 2006. The venue has a seating capacity of 19,522 and is known for its versatility in accommodating various sporting and entertainment events.

Title: Times Union Center
Description: The Times Union Center is a multi-purpose arena located in Albany, New York. It has hosted several UFC events, including UFC Fight Night: Lewis vs. Abdurakhimov in 2016 and UFC Fight Night: Lee vs. Oliveira in 2020. The venue offers a seating capacity of approximately 17,500 and has become a popular destination for UFC fans in the Northeastern United States.

Title: Tingley Coliseum
Description: Tingley Coliseum is an indoor arena located in Albuquerque, New Mexico. It has hosted several UFC events, including UFC Fight Night: Henderson vs. Khabilov in 2014 and UFC Fight Night: Condit vs. Kampmann 2 in 2013. The venue has a seating capacity of approximately 11,571 and is known for its historic significance in the region's combat sports scene.

Title: Tokyo Bay NK Hall
Description: Tokyo Bay NK Hall is a renowned UFC venue located in Tokyo, Japan. It has hosted several notable UFC events, including UFC 23: Ultimate Japan, UFC 25: Ultimate Japan 3, and UFC 29: Defense of the Belts. With its capacity to accommodate thousands of spectators, the venue has become a popular destination for UFC fans in Japan.

Title: Toyota Center
Description: The Toyota Center is a multi-purpose indoor arena located in Houston, Texas, United States. It has hosted several UFC events, including UFC 69 in 2007, where Georges St-Pierre defeated Matt Serra to become the Welterweight Champion. The venue has also hosted UFC 166 in 2013, featuring a heavyweight title fight between Cain Velasquez and Junior dos Santos.

Title: Trump Taj Mahal
Description: The Trump Taj Mahal, located in Atlantic City, New Jersey, served as a venue for several UFC events. It hosted UFC 28 in 2000, UFC 30 in 2001, and UFC 53 in 2005. These events featured notable fighters such as Randy Couture, Tito Ortiz, and Chuck Liddell. The venue provided a spacious arena for thrilling mixed martial arts competitions.

Title: U.S. Airways Center
Description: The U.S. Airways Center, located in Phoenix, Arizona, has hosted several UFC events. Notable events include UFC on Fox: dos Santos vs. Miocic in 2014, UFC on Fox: Poirier vs. Gaethje in 2018, and UFC on ESPN: Ngannou vs. Velasquez in 2019. The venue has a seating capacity of approximately 18,422 and offers state-of-the-art facilities for mixed martial arts competitions.

Title: U.S. Bank Arena
Description: U.S. Bank Arena, located in Cincinnati, Ohio, is a multi-purpose indoor arena that has hosted several UFC events. Notable UFC events held at this venue include UFC Fight Night: Brown vs. Silva in 2014 and UFC Fight Night: Cerrone vs. Miller in 2015. With a seating capacity of approximately 17,500, the arena provides a suitable setting for thrilling mixed martial arts competitions.

Title: UBS Arena
Description: The UBS Arena is a multi-purpose indoor arena located in Elmont, New York. It serves as a prominent venue for UFC events, hosting several high-profile fights since its opening in 2021. Notable UFC events held at the UBS Arena include championship bouts and exciting matchups featuring renowned fighters from various weight classes. The arena's state-of-the-art facilities and capacity to accommodate large crowds make it a preferred choice for UFC events in the region.

Title: UFC 1: The Beginning
Description: UFC 1: The Beginning was the inaugural event of the Ultimate Fighting Championship (UFC) held on November 12, 1993, in Denver, Colorado. Taking place at the McNichols Sports Arena, this groundbreaking tournament featured an eight-man elimination style competition, showcasing various martial arts disciplines. The event marked the birth of modern mixed martial arts, captivating audiences with its raw intensity and unpredictable outcomes.

Title: UFC 10: The Tournament
Description: UFC 10: The Tournament was a mixed martial arts event held on July 12, 1996, at the Fairgrounds Arena in Birmingham, Alabama. This event featured an eight-man tournament format, with Mark Coleman emerging as the tournament champion. Notable fights included a rematch between Coleman and Don Frye, as well as a clash between Gary Goodridge and Tank Abbott. UFC 10 showcased the evolution of the sport and its growing popularity.

Title: UFC 100
Description: UFC 100 was a milestone event in mixed martial arts held on July 11, 2009, at the Mandalay Bay Events Center in Las Vegas, Nevada. This historic event featured a stacked card, including two championship bouts: Brock Lesnar vs. Frank Mir for the heavyweight title and Georges St-Pierre vs. Thiago Alves for the welterweight title. UFC 100 marked the promotion's centennial event and showcased the sport's growing popularity.

Title: UFC 101: Declaration
Description: UFC 101: Declaration was a mixed martial arts event held on August 8, 2009, at the Wachovia Center in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The main event featured a lightweight championship bout between BJ Penn and Kenny Florian, with Penn successfully defending his title. Additionally, Anderson Silva showcased his dominance in the middleweight division, defeating Forrest Griffin in a memorable fight. This event marked the UFC's first visit to Philadelphia.

Title: UFC 102: Couture vs. Nogueira
Description: UFC 102: Couture vs. Nogueira was a mixed martial arts event held on August 29, 2009, at the Rose Garden in Portland, Oregon. The main event featured a highly anticipated heavyweight clash between Randy Couture and Antônio Rodrigo Nogueira. This event marked the first time two former UFC champions faced each other in the heavyweight division. The card also showcased notable fighters such as Keith Jardine, Thiago Silva, and Nate Marquardt.

Title: UFC 103: Franklin vs. Belfort
Description: UFC 103: Franklin vs. Belfort was a mixed martial arts event held on September 19, 2009, at the American Airlines Center in Dallas, Texas. The main event featured a clash between former UFC Middleweight Champion Rich Franklin and Brazilian knockout artist Vitor Belfort. This event marked Belfort's return to the UFC after a four-year absence. Notable fights included Mirko Cro Cop vs. Junior dos Santos and Josh Koscheck vs. Frank Trigg.

Title: UFC 104: Machida vs. Shogun
Description: UFC 104: Machida vs. Shogun was a mixed martial arts event held on October 24, 2009, at the Staples Center in Los Angeles, California. The main event featured a highly anticipated light heavyweight championship bout between Lyoto Machida and Mauricio "Shogun" Rua. The fight ended in a controversial unanimous decision victory for Machida, sparking much debate among fans and experts. This event marked the first defense of Machida's title.

Title: UFC 105: Couture vs. Vera
Description: UFC 105: Couture vs. Vera was a mixed martial arts event held on November 14, 2009, at the Manchester Evening News Arena in Manchester, England. The main event featured a heavyweight clash between Randy Couture and Brandon Vera. The event also showcased notable fights such as Michael Bisping vs. Denis Kang and Dan Hardy vs. Mike Swick. UFC 105 marked the promotion's second visit to Manchester.

Title: UFC 106: Ortiz vs. Griffin 2
Description: UFC 106: Ortiz vs. Griffin 2 was a mixed martial arts event held on November 21, 2009, at the Mandalay Bay Events Center in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a rematch between former UFC Light Heavyweight Champions Tito Ortiz and Forrest Griffin. The event also showcased a heavyweight clash between Josh Koscheck and Anthony Johnson. It was an exciting night of intense competition and memorable moments in the octagon.

Title: UFC 107: Penn vs. Sanchez
Description: UFC 107: Penn vs. Sanchez was a mixed martial arts event held on December 12, 2009, at the FedExForum in Memphis, Tennessee. The main event featured a lightweight championship bout between B.J. Penn and Diego Sanchez. Penn successfully defended his title, dominating Sanchez throughout the fight. The event also showcased notable fights such as Frank Mir vs. Cheick Kongo and Jon Fitch vs. Mike Pierce.

Title: UFC 108: Evans vs. Silva
Description: UFC 108: Evans vs. Silva was a mixed martial arts event held on January 2, 2010, at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a light heavyweight bout between Rashad Evans and Thiago Silva. Notable fights included Paul Daley vs. Dustin Hazelett and Junior dos Santos vs. Gilbert Yvel. This event marked the return of Evans after a year-long layoff due to injury.

Title: UFC 109: Relentless
Description: UFC 109: Relentless was a mixed martial arts event held on February 6, 2010, at the Mandalay Bay Events Center in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a clash between two UFC Hall of Famers, Randy Couture and Mark Coleman. Other notable fights included a middleweight bout between Nate Marquardt and Chael Sonnen. This event marked the first time two UFC Hall of Famers faced each other in the octagon.

Title: UFC 11: The Proving Ground
Description: UFC 11: The Proving Ground was held on September 20, 1996, at the Augusta Civic Center in Augusta, Georgia. This event marked the first time the UFC introduced weight classes, with the tournament featuring four weight divisions. Notable fights included the heavyweight clash between Mark Coleman and Scott Ferrozzo, as well as the lightweight bout between B.J. Penn and Joey Gilbert. The event showcased the evolution of mixed martial arts and set the stage for future UFC tournaments.

Title: UFC 110: Nogueira vs. Velasquez
Description: UFC 110: Nogueira vs. Velasquez was a mixed martial arts event held on February 21, 2010, at the Acer Arena in Sydney, Australia. The main event featured a heavyweight clash between Antonio Rodrigo Nogueira and Cain Velasquez. This event marked the UFC's debut in Australia and drew a record-breaking crowd of 17,831 spectators. Notable fights included Wanderlei Silva vs. Michael Bisping and George Sotiropoulos vs. Joe Stevenson.

Title: UFC 111: St-Pierre vs. Hardy
Description: UFC 111: St-Pierre vs. Hardy was a mixed martial arts event held on March 27, 2010, at the Prudential Center in Newark, New Jersey. The main event featured Georges St-Pierre defending his welterweight title against Dan Hardy. Additionally, the co-main event showcased Shane Carwin defeating Frank Mir to claim the interim heavyweight championship. This event marked St-Pierre's sixth successful title defense.

Title: UFC 112: Invincible
Description: UFC 112: Invincible was a mixed martial arts event held on April 10, 2010, at the Ferrari World in Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates. This historic event marked the first time the UFC held an outdoor event and the first event in the Middle East. The main event featured Anderson Silva successfully defending his Middleweight Championship against Demian Maia. The event also showcased a highly anticipated Lightweight Championship bout between Frankie Edgar and BJ Penn.

Title: UFC 113: Machida vs. Shogun 2
Description: UFC 113: Machida vs. Shogun 2 was a mixed martial arts event held on May 8, 2010, at the Bell Centre in Montreal, Quebec, Canada. The main event featured a highly anticipated rematch between Lyoto Machida and Mauricio "Shogun" Rua for the UFC Light Heavyweight Championship. Rua emerged victorious, avenging his controversial loss in their previous encounter. The event also showcased notable fights such as Josh Koscheck vs. Paul Daley and Kimbo Slice vs. Matt Mitrione.

Title: UFC 114: Rampage vs. Evans
Description: UFC 114: Rampage vs. Evans was a mixed martial arts event held on May 29, 2010, at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a highly anticipated grudge match between former UFC light heavyweight champions Quinton "Rampage" Jackson and Rashad Evans. This event marked the first time two African-American fighters headlined a major UFC event. The fight ended with Evans securing a unanimous decision victory.

Title: UFC 115: Liddell vs. Franklin
Description: UFC 115: Liddell vs. Franklin was a mixed martial arts event held on June 12, 2010, at the General Motors Place in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada. The main event featured a highly anticipated bout between UFC legends Chuck Liddell and Rich Franklin. This event marked the first time the UFC held an event in Vancouver, making it a significant milestone for Canadian MMA fans.

Title: UFC 116: Lesnar vs. Carwin
Description: UFC 116: Lesnar vs. Carwin was a mixed martial arts event held on July 3, 2010, at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a highly anticipated heavyweight championship bout between Brock Lesnar and Shane Carwin. Lesnar survived a brutal onslaught from Carwin in the first round to secure a submission victory in the second, retaining his title. This event marked Lesnar's successful return after a year-long absence due to illness.

Title: UFC 117: Silva vs. Sonnen
Description: UFC 117: Silva vs. Sonnen was a mixed martial arts event held on August 7, 2010, at the Oracle Arena in Oakland, California. The main event featured a highly anticipated middleweight championship bout between Anderson Silva and Chael Sonnen. Sonnen dominated the fight for four rounds, but Silva secured a dramatic come-from-behind victory with a triangle armbar submission in the final round, solidifying his status as one of the greatest fighters in UFC history.

Title: UFC 118: Edgar vs. Penn 2
Description: UFC 118: Edgar vs. Penn 2 was a mixed martial arts event held on August 28, 2010, at the TD Garden in Boston, Massachusetts. The main event featured a rematch between Frankie Edgar and B.J. Penn for the UFC Lightweight Championship. Notably, Edgar defeated Penn for the second time, solidifying his status as the champion. The event also showcased other exciting matchups, making it a memorable night for MMA fans.

Title: UFC 119: Mir vs. Cro Cop
Description: UFC 119: Mir vs. Cro Cop was a mixed martial arts event held on September 25, 2010, at the Conseco Fieldhouse in Indianapolis, Indiana. The main event featured a heavyweight clash between former UFC champion Frank Mir and legendary striker Mirko Cro Cop. The event also showcased notable fights such as Ryan Bader vs. Antônio Rogério Nogueira and Chris Lytle vs. Matt Serra.

Title: UFC 12: Judgement Day
Description: UFC 12: Judgement Day was held on February 7, 1997, at the Dothan Civic Center in Dothan, Alabama. This event marked the first time the UFC introduced weight classes, with a heavyweight and lightweight tournament. The main event featured a heavyweight championship bout between Vitor Belfort and Scott Ferrozzo. Additionally, the event showcased the debut of future UFC Hall of Famer Mark Coleman, who won the heavyweight tournament.

Title: UFC 120: Bisping vs. Akiyama
Description: UFC 120: Bisping vs. Akiyama was a mixed martial arts event held on October 16, 2010, at The O2 Arena in London, England. The main event featured a thrilling middleweight bout between Michael Bisping and Yoshihiro Akiyama. Notable fights included a welterweight clash between Dan Hardy and Carlos Condit. This event marked the UFC's return to London after a five-year absence, drawing a crowd of over 17,000 spectators.

Title: UFC 121: Lesnar vs. Velasquez
Description: UFC 121: Lesnar vs. Velasquez was a mixed martial arts event held on October 23, 2010, at the Honda Center in Anaheim, California. The main event featured a heavyweight championship bout between Brock Lesnar and Cain Velasquez. Velasquez emerged victorious, becoming the first Mexican-American UFC heavyweight champion. This event marked Lesnar's first loss in the UFC.

Title: UFC 122: Marquardt vs. Okami
Description: UFC 122: Marquardt vs. Okami was a mixed martial arts event held on November 13, 2010, at the König Pilsener Arena in Oberhausen, Germany. The main event featured a middleweight clash between Nate Marquardt and Yushin Okami. This event marked the UFC's second visit to Germany and showcased a lineup of exciting fights, including notable bouts between Jorge Rivera and Alessio Sakara, as well as Krzysztof Soszynski and Goran Reljic.

Title: UFC 123: Rampage vs. Machida
Description: UFC 123: Rampage vs. Machida was a mixed martial arts event held on November 20, 2010, at The Palace of Auburn Hills in Auburn Hills, Michigan. The main event featured a highly anticipated bout between former UFC Light Heavyweight Champions Quinton "Rampage" Jackson and Lyoto Machida. This event marked the first time the UFC had returned to Michigan since UFC 9 in 1996.

Title: UFC 124: St-Pierre vs. Koscheck 2
Description: UFC 124: St-Pierre vs. Koscheck 2 was a mixed martial arts event held on December 11, 2010, at the Bell Centre in Montreal, Quebec, Canada. The main event featured a highly anticipated rematch between welterweight champion Georges St-Pierre and Josh Koscheck. St-Pierre dominated the fight, winning by unanimous decision. This event marked St-Pierre's fifth successful title defense and solidified his status as one of the greatest welterweights in UFC history.

Title: UFC 125: Resolution
Description: UFC 125: Resolution was a mixed martial arts event held on January 1, 2011, at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a lightweight championship bout between Frankie Edgar and Gray Maynard, resulting in a thrilling draw. Notably, this event marked the first time in UFC history that a title fight ended in a draw.

Title: UFC 126: Silva vs. Belfort
Description: UFC 126: Silva vs. Belfort was a mixed martial arts event held on February 5, 2011, at the Mandalay Bay Events Center in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a highly anticipated middleweight championship bout between Anderson Silva and Vitor Belfort. Silva successfully defended his title with a stunning front kick knockout in the first round. This event also showcased notable fights such as Jon Jones vs. Ryan Bader and Forrest Griffin vs. Rich Franklin.

Title: UFC 127: Penn vs. Fitch
Description: UFC 127: Penn vs. Fitch was a mixed martial arts event held on February 27, 2011, at the Acer Arena in Sydney, Australia. The main event featured a welterweight bout between former UFC Lightweight Champion BJ Penn and Jon Fitch. This event marked the UFC's return to Australia after a decade and showcased a thrilling fight card with notable matchups, including Michael Bisping vs. Jorge Rivera and George Sotiropoulos vs. Dennis Siver.

Title: UFC 128: Shogun vs. Jones
Description: UFC 128: Shogun vs. Jones was a mixed martial arts event held on March 19, 2011, at the Prudential Center in Newark, New Jersey. The main event featured a light heavyweight championship bout between Mauricio "Shogun" Rua and Jon Jones. Jones emerged victorious, becoming the youngest champion in UFC history at the age of 23. This event marked the first time the UFC held an event in Newark.

Title: UFC 129: St-Pierre vs. Shields
Description: UFC 129: St-Pierre vs. Shields was a mixed martial arts event held on April 30, 2011, at the Rogers Centre in Toronto, Canada. With a record-breaking attendance of over 55,000 fans, it remains the largest UFC event in history. The main event featured Georges St-Pierre defending his welterweight title against Jake Shields. Notably, this event marked the UFC's debut in Ontario, Canada.

Title: UFC 13: The Ultimate Force
Description: UFC 13: The Ultimate Force was a mixed martial arts event held on May 30, 1997, at the Augusta Civic Center in Augusta, Georgia. This event featured a four-man heavyweight tournament, with Randy Couture emerging as the champion. Notably, it was the first UFC event to introduce weight classes, marking a significant milestone in the evolution of the sport.

Title: UFC 130: Rampage vs. Hamill
Description: UFC 130: Rampage vs. Hamill was a mixed martial arts event held on May 28, 2011, at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a light heavyweight bout between Quinton "Rampage" Jackson and Matt Hamill. Notable fights included a co-main event between Frank Mir and Roy Nelson, as well as a thrilling matchup between Brian Stann and Jorge Santiago.

Title: UFC 131: dos Santos vs. Carwin
Description: UFC 131: dos Santos vs. Carwin was a mixed martial arts event held on June 11, 2011, at Rogers Arena in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada. The main event featured a heavyweight clash between Junior dos Santos and Shane Carwin, with dos Santos emerging victorious via unanimous decision. Notably, this event marked the first time the UFC held an event in Vancouver since the sport was legalized in the province.

Title: UFC 132: Cruz vs. Faber
Description: UFC 132: Cruz vs. Faber was a mixed martial arts event held on July 2, 2011, at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a bantamweight championship bout between Dominick Cruz and Urijah Faber. This event marked the first time the bantamweight title was defended since its inception. Cruz successfully defended his title, winning by unanimous decision after an intense five-round battle.

Title: UFC 133: Evans vs. Ortiz
Description: UFC 133: Evans vs. Ortiz was a mixed martial arts event held on August 6, 2011, at the Wells Fargo Center in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. The main event featured a highly anticipated rematch between former light heavyweight champions Rashad Evans and Tito Ortiz. Other notable fights included Vitor Belfort vs. Yoshihiro Akiyama and Dennis Hallman vs. Brian Ebersole. The event drew a crowd of over 11,500 spectators.

Title: UFC 134: Silva vs. Okami
Description: UFC 134: Silva vs. Okami was a mixed martial arts event held on August 27, 2011, at the HSBC Arena in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. The main event featured a Middleweight Championship bout between Anderson Silva and Yushin Okami. This event marked the first time the UFC returned to Brazil since 1998 and was highly anticipated by fans worldwide. Silva successfully defended his title, winning by TKO in the second round.

Title: UFC 135: Jones vs. Rampage
Description: UFC 135: Jones vs. Rampage was a mixed martial arts event held on September 24, 2011, at the Pepsi Center in Denver, Colorado. The main event featured a light heavyweight championship bout between Jon Jones and Quinton "Rampage" Jackson. Jones successfully defended his title, showcasing his dominant skills. This event marked the first time the UFC held a pay-per-view event in Denver since 1995.

Title: UFC 136: Edgar vs. Maynard III
Description: UFC 136: Edgar vs. Maynard III was a mixed martial arts event held on October 8, 2011, at the Toyota Center in Houston, Texas. The main event featured a highly anticipated lightweight championship rematch between Frankie Edgar and Gray Maynard. Edgar successfully defended his title, winning by knockout in the fourth round. The event also showcased a featherweight title fight between José Aldo and Kenny Florian, with Aldo emerging victorious.

Title: UFC 137: Penn vs. Diaz
Description: UFC 137: Penn vs. Diaz was a mixed martial arts event held on October 29, 2011, at the Mandalay Bay Events Center in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a welterweight bout between former champions BJ Penn and Nick Diaz. Notably, this event marked the first time in UFC history that a title fight was canceled on the day of the event, as Georges St-Pierre withdrew due to injury.

Title: UFC 138: Leben vs. Muñoz
Description: UFC 138: Leben vs. Muñoz was a mixed martial arts event held on November 5, 2011, at the LG Arena in Birmingham, England. The main event featured a middleweight bout between Chris Leben and Mark Muñoz. This event marked the first time the UFC held a non-title fight as the headliner since UFC 115 in 2010. It was also the first UFC event to be broadcast live on Fuel TV.

Title: UFC 139: Shogun vs. Henderson
Description: UFC 139: Shogun vs. Henderson was a mixed martial arts event held on November 19, 2011, at the HP Pavilion in San Jose, California. The main event featured a thrilling five-round battle between Mauricio "Shogun" Rua and Dan Henderson, resulting in a unanimous decision victory for Henderson. This event is remembered for its intense matchups and the legendary display of heart and skill by both fighters.

Title: UFC 14: Showdown
Description: UFC 14: Showdown was a mixed martial arts event held on July 27, 1997, at the Boutwell Memorial Auditorium in Birmingham, Alabama. The event featured a highly anticipated heavyweight championship bout between Maurice Smith and Mark Coleman, with Smith emerging victorious. Additionally, notable fighters such as Kevin Jackson, Tony Fryklund, and Jeremy Horn showcased their skills, making UFC 14 an exciting and memorable event in the early days of the UFC.

Title: UFC 140: Jones vs. Machida
Description: UFC 140: Jones vs. Machida was a mixed martial arts event held on December 10, 2011, at the Air Canada Centre in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. The main event featured a light heavyweight championship bout between Jon Jones and Lyoto Machida. Jones successfully defended his title with a second-round submission victory. The event also showcased notable fights such as Frank Mir defeating Antônio Rodrigo Nogueira via submission.

Title: UFC 141: Lesnar vs. Overeem
Description: UFC 141: Lesnar vs. Overeem was a mixed martial arts event held on December 30, 2011, at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a highly anticipated heavyweight clash between Brock Lesnar and Alistair Overeem. Overeem emerged victorious, securing a first-round TKO victory over Lesnar, marking Lesnar's last fight in the UFC. The event also showcased notable fights such as Nate Diaz vs. Donald Cerrone and Jon Fitch vs. Johny Hendricks.

Title: UFC 142: Aldo vs. Mendes
Description: UFC 142: Aldo vs. Mendes was a mixed martial arts event held on January 14, 2012, at the HSBC Arena in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. The main event featured a featherweight championship bout between José Aldo and Chad Mendes. Aldo successfully defended his title with a knockout in the first round. This event marked the UFC's return to Brazil after a 13-year absence.

Title: UFC 143: Diaz vs. Condit
Description: UFC 143: Diaz vs. Condit was a mixed martial arts event held on February 4, 2012, at the Mandalay Bay Events Center in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a welterweight title bout between Nick Diaz and Carlos Condit, which Condit won via unanimous decision. This event marked the first time in UFC history that the interim welterweight championship was awarded.

Title: UFC 144: Edgar vs. Henderson
Description: UFC 144: Edgar vs. Henderson was a mixed martial arts event held on February 26, 2012, at the Saitama Super Arena in Saitama, Japan. The main event featured a lightweight championship bout between Frankie Edgar and Benson Henderson. This event marked the UFC's return to Japan after a 12-year absence and showcased several exciting fights, including a knockout victory by Anthony Pettis over Joe Lauzon.

Title: UFC 145: Jones vs. Evans
Description: UFC 145: Jones vs. Evans was a mixed martial arts event held on April 21, 2012, at the Philips Arena in Atlanta, Georgia. The main event featured a highly anticipated light heavyweight championship bout between Jon Jones and Rashad Evans. This event marked the first time two former teammates faced each other for the UFC title. Jones emerged victorious, solidifying his dominance in the division.

Title: UFC 146: dos Santos vs. Mir
Description: UFC 146: dos Santos vs. Mir was a mixed martial arts event held on May 26, 2012, at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a heavyweight championship bout between Junior dos Santos and Frank Mir. This event was notable for being the first time in UFC history that the main card consisted entirely of heavyweight fights.

Title: UFC 147: Silva vs. Franklin II
Description: UFC 147: Silva vs. Franklin II was a mixed martial arts event held on June 23, 2012, at the Estádio Jornalista Felipe Drumond in Belo Horizonte, Brazil. The main event featured a rematch between Anderson Silva and Rich Franklin, with Silva emerging victorious. This event marked the first time the UFC held an event in Belo Horizonte and showcased the growing popularity of MMA in Brazil.

Title: UFC 148: Silva vs. Sonnen II
Description: UFC 148: Silva vs. Sonnen II was a mixed martial arts event held on July 7, 2012, at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a highly anticipated rematch between Anderson Silva and Chael Sonnen for the UFC Middleweight Championship. Silva successfully defended his title with a TKO victory in the second round, avenging his previous loss to Sonnen.

Title: UFC 149: Faber vs. Barão
Description: UFC 149: Faber vs. Barão was a mixed martial arts event held on July 21, 2012, at the Scotiabank Saddledome in Calgary, Alberta, Canada. The main event featured a bantamweight title fight between Urijah Faber and Renan Barão. This event marked the UFC's debut in Calgary and was highly anticipated by fans. Despite some last-minute changes to the fight card, the event delivered thrilling matchups and showcased the talent of rising stars in the sport.

Title: UFC 15: Collision Course
Description: UFC 15: Collision Course was a mixed martial arts event held on October 17, 1997, at the Casino Magic in Bay St. Louis, Mississippi. This event featured a heavyweight championship bout between Maurice Smith and Tank Abbott, with Smith emerging victorious. Additionally, the event showcased the first appearance of future UFC Hall of Famer Randy Couture, who defeated Vitor Belfort. UFC 15 marked the first time the promotion implemented weight classes.

Title: UFC 150: Henderson vs. Edgar II
Description: UFC 150: Henderson vs. Edgar II was a mixed martial arts event held on August 11, 2012, at the Pepsi Center in Denver, Colorado. The main event featured a rematch between Benson Henderson and Frankie Edgar for the UFC Lightweight Championship. This event marked the second encounter between the two fighters, following their closely contested bout at UFC 144.

Title: UFC 151: Jones vs. Henderson
Description: UFC 151: Jones vs. Henderson was a mixed martial arts event held on September 1, 2012, at the Mandalay Bay Events Center in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a highly anticipated bout between Jon Jones and Dan Henderson for the UFC Light Heavyweight Championship. However, the event was ultimately canceled due to a last-minute injury to Henderson, making it the first UFC event to be called off in the organization's history.

Title: UFC 152: Jones vs. Belfort
Description: UFC 152: Jones vs. Belfort was a mixed martial arts event held on September 22, 2012, at the Air Canada Centre in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. The main event featured a light heavyweight championship bout between Jon Jones and Vitor Belfort. This event marked the first time the UFC held a flyweight title fight, with Demetrious Johnson defeating Joseph Benavidez to become the inaugural UFC Flyweight Champion.

Title: UFC 153: Silva vs. Bonnar
Description: UFC 153: Silva vs. Bonnar was a mixed martial arts event held on October 13, 2012, at the HSBC Arena in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. The main event featured a catchweight bout between Anderson Silva and Stephan Bonnar. Silva, the reigning middleweight champion, moved up to light heavyweight for this fight. The event also showcased notable fights such as Glover Teixeira vs. Fabio Maldonado and Jon Fitch vs. Erick Silva.

Title: UFC 154: St-Pierre vs. Condit
Description: UFC 154: St-Pierre vs. Condit was a mixed martial arts event held on November 17, 2012, at the Bell Centre in Montreal, Quebec, Canada. The main event featured a welterweight championship bout between Georges St-Pierre and Carlos Condit. St-Pierre successfully defended his title, winning via unanimous decision after a thrilling five-round battle. This event marked St-Pierre's return to the octagon after a lengthy injury layoff.

Title: UFC 155: dos Santos vs. Velasquez 2
Description: UFC 155: dos Santos vs. Velasquez 2 was a mixed martial arts event held on December 29, 2012, at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a highly anticipated rematch between Junior dos Santos and Cain Velasquez for the UFC Heavyweight Championship. Velasquez emerged victorious, reclaiming the title in a dominant performance. The event also showcased other notable fights, making it a memorable night for MMA fans.

Title: UFC 156: Aldo vs. Edgar
Description: UFC 156: Aldo vs. Edgar was a mixed martial arts event held on February 2, 2013, at the Mandalay Bay Events Center in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a featherweight championship bout between José Aldo and Frankie Edgar. Notable fights included Antonio Rogerio Nogueira vs. Rashad Evans and Alistair Overeem vs. Antonio Silva. This event marked the first time Edgar competed in the featherweight division.

Title: UFC 157: Rousey vs. Carmouche
Description: UFC 157: Rousey vs. Carmouche was a mixed martial arts event held on February 23, 2013, at the Honda Center in Anaheim, California. It marked the first-ever women's bout in UFC history, featuring Ronda Rousey defending her bantamweight title against Liz Carmouche. This groundbreaking event showcased the growing prominence of women in the sport and set the stage for future female fighters in the UFC.

Title: UFC 158: St-Pierre vs. Diaz
Description: UFC 158: St-Pierre vs. Diaz was a mixed martial arts event held on March 16, 2013, at the Bell Centre in Montreal, Quebec, Canada. The main event featured a welterweight championship bout between Georges St-Pierre and Nick Diaz. This highly anticipated event showcased the clash of two charismatic fighters known for their intense rivalry and trash-talking. St-Pierre successfully defended his title, winning by unanimous decision after five rounds of thrilling action.

Title: UFC 159: Jones vs. Sonnen
Description: UFC 159: Jones vs. Sonnen was a mixed martial arts event held on April 27, 2013, at the Prudential Center in Newark, New Jersey. The main event featured a light heavyweight championship bout between Jon Jones and Chael Sonnen. This event marked the first time that Jones defended his title against a non-former champion. It also set the record for the latest stoppage due to a doctor's intervention in a UFC title fight.

Title: UFC 16: Battle in the Bayou
Description: UFC 16: Battle in the Bayou was a mixed martial arts event held on March 13, 1998, at the Pontchartrain Center in Kenner, Louisiana. This event featured a heavyweight championship bout between Frank Shamrock and Igor Zinoviev, with Shamrock emerging victorious. Additionally, the event showcased notable fighters such as Pat Miletich, Mikey Burnett, and Jeremy Horn, making it an exciting night for MMA fans.

Title: UFC 160: Velasquez vs. Bigfoot 2
Description: UFC 160: Velasquez vs. Bigfoot 2 was a mixed martial arts event held on May 25, 2013, at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a heavyweight championship rematch between Cain Velasquez and Antonio "Bigfoot" Silva. Velasquez successfully defended his title, defeating Silva via TKO in the first round. The event also showcased a thrilling co-main event between Junior dos Santos and Mark Hunt.

Title: UFC 161: Evans vs. Henderson
Description: UFC 161: Evans vs. Henderson was a mixed martial arts event held on June 15, 2013, at the MTS Centre in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada. The main event featured a highly anticipated bout between former UFC light heavyweight champion Rashad Evans and former PRIDE champion Dan Henderson. This event marked the first time the UFC held an event in Winnipeg, making it a significant milestone for Canadian MMA fans.

Title: UFC 162: Silva vs. Weidman
Description: UFC 162: Silva vs. Weidman was a mixed martial arts event held on July 6, 2013, at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a highly anticipated middleweight championship bout between long-reigning champion Anderson Silva and Chris Weidman. Weidman shocked the world by knocking out Silva in the second round, ending Silva's record-breaking title reign. This event marked a significant turning point in the middleweight division.

Title: UFC 163: Aldo vs. Korean Zombie
Description: UFC 163: Aldo vs. Korean Zombie was a mixed martial arts event held on August 3, 2013, at the HSBC Arena in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. The main event featured a featherweight title bout between champion José Aldo and challenger Chan Sung Jung, also known as the Korean Zombie. Aldo successfully defended his title with a fourth-round TKO, showcasing his exceptional striking skills. The event drew significant attention due to the thrilling matchup between two highly skilled fighters.

Title: UFC 164: Henderson vs. Pettis 2
Description: UFC 164: Henderson vs. Pettis 2 was a mixed martial arts event held on August 31, 2013, at the Bradley Center in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. The main event featured a highly anticipated rematch between Benson Henderson and Anthony Pettis for the UFC Lightweight Championship. Pettis emerged victorious with a stunning first-round submission, becoming the new champion. The event also showcased notable fights such as Frank Mir vs. Josh Barnett and Chad Mendes vs. Clay Guida.

Title: UFC 165: Jones vs. Gustafsson
Description: UFC 165: Jones vs. Gustafsson was a mixed martial arts event held on September 21, 2013, at the Air Canada Centre in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. The main event featured a highly anticipated light heavyweight championship bout between Jon Jones and Alexander Gustafsson, which is widely regarded as one of the greatest fights in UFC history. Jones successfully defended his title in a closely contested five-round battle.

Title: UFC 166: Velasquez vs. dos Santos III
Description: UFC 166: Velasquez vs. dos Santos III was a mixed martial arts event held on October 19, 2013, at the Toyota Center in Houston, Texas. The main event featured a highly anticipated trilogy fight between heavyweight champion Cain Velasquez and Junior dos Santos. Velasquez emerged victorious, defending his title in a thrilling five-round battle. This event is remembered for its intense action and the dominance displayed by Velasquez.

Title: UFC 167: St-Pierre vs. Hendricks
Description: UFC 167: St-Pierre vs. Hendricks was a mixed martial arts event held on November 16, 2013, at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a welterweight championship bout between Georges St-Pierre and Johny Hendricks, which resulted in a controversial split decision victory for St-Pierre. This event marked St-Pierre's ninth successful title defense, tying the record for most wins in UFC history.

Title: UFC 168: Weidman vs. Silva 2
Description: UFC 168: Weidman vs. Silva 2 was a mixed martial arts event held on December 28, 2013, at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a highly anticipated rematch between Chris Weidman and Anderson Silva for the UFC Middleweight Championship. Weidman emerged victorious once again, defeating Silva via TKO in the second round. This event is remembered for the shocking leg injury Silva suffered during the fight.

Title: UFC 169: Barão vs. Faber 2
Description: UFC 169: Barão vs. Faber 2 was a mixed martial arts event held on February 1, 2014, at the Prudential Center in Newark, New Jersey. The main event featured a bantamweight title fight between Renan Barão and Urijah Faber. This event also showcased a featherweight title bout between José Aldo and Ricardo Lamas. It was an exciting night of high-level competition and marked the second meeting between Barão and Faber.

Title: UFC 17: Redemption
Description: UFC 17: Redemption was a mixed martial arts event held on May 15, 1998, at the Mobile Civic Center in Mobile, Alabama. The event featured a highly anticipated rematch between Dan Severn and Mark Coleman for the UFC Heavyweight Championship. Additionally, notable fighters such as Pete Williams, Pat Miletich, and Jeremy Horn showcased their skills in thrilling matchups. UFC 17 marked a pivotal moment in the sport's history, solidifying its growing popularity.

Title: UFC 170: Rousey vs. McMann
Description: UFC 170: Rousey vs. McMann was a mixed martial arts event held on February 22, 2014, at the Mandalay Bay Events Center in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a women's bantamweight championship bout between Ronda Rousey and Sara McMann. This event marked the first time two Olympic medalists faced each other in the Octagon. Rousey successfully defended her title, winning by TKO in just 66 seconds.

Title: UFC 171: Hendricks vs. Lawler
Description: UFC 171: Hendricks vs. Lawler was a mixed martial arts event held on March 15, 2014, at the American Airlines Center in Dallas, Texas. The main event featured a thrilling welterweight championship bout between Johny Hendricks and Robbie Lawler, with Lawler emerging victorious. This event marked the first time the vacant welterweight title was contested since Georges St-Pierre's retirement.

Title: UFC 172: Jones vs. Teixeira
Description: UFC 172: Jones vs. Teixeira was a mixed martial arts event held on April 26, 2014, at the Baltimore Arena in Baltimore, Maryland. The main event featured a light heavyweight championship bout between Jon Jones and Glover Teixeira. Jones successfully defended his title, showcasing his dominant skills. This event marked the first time the UFC visited Baltimore, creating an exciting atmosphere for fans in attendance.

Title: UFC 173: Barão vs. Dillashaw
Description: UFC 173: Barão vs. Dillashaw was a mixed martial arts event held on May 24, 2014, at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a bantamweight title fight between Renan Barão and TJ Dillashaw, with Dillashaw stunning the world by knocking out Barão in the fifth round to become the new champion. This event marked a significant upset in the UFC's bantamweight division.

Title: UFC 174: Johnson vs. Bagautinov
Description: UFC 174: Johnson vs. Bagautinov was a mixed martial arts event held on June 14, 2014, at Rogers Arena in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada. The main event featured a flyweight championship bout between Demetrious Johnson and Ali Bagautinov. Notable fights included a welterweight clash between Rory MacDonald and Tyron Woodley. This event marked the first time the UFC held an event in Vancouver since UFC 131 in 2011.

Title: UFC 175: Weidman vs. Machida
Description: UFC 175: Weidman vs. Machida was a mixed martial arts event held on July 5, 2014, at the Mandalay Bay Events Center in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a middleweight championship bout between Chris Weidman and Lyoto Machida. Weidman successfully defended his title, winning via unanimous decision after an intense five-round battle. The event also showcased other notable fights, making it a memorable night for UFC fans.

Title: UFC 176: Aldo vs. Mendes II
Description: UFC 176: Aldo vs. Mendes II was a mixed martial arts event held on August 2, 2014, at the Staples Center in Los Angeles, California. The main event featured a highly anticipated rematch between UFC Featherweight Champion Jose Aldo and Chad Mendes. Unfortunately, the event was ultimately canceled due to Aldo's injury, making it the first UFC pay-per-view event to be called off since UFC 151 in 2012.

Title: UFC 177: Dillashaw vs. Soto
Description: UFC 177: Dillashaw vs. Soto was a mixed martial arts event held on August 30, 2014, at the Sleep Train Arena in Sacramento, California. The main event featured a bantamweight title fight between champion TJ Dillashaw and Joe Soto, who stepped in as a late replacement. This event marked the first time a UFC title fight headlined a card without a previously scheduled main event.

Title: UFC 178: Johnson vs. Cariaso
Description: UFC 178: Johnson vs. Cariaso was a mixed martial arts event held on September 27, 2014, at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a flyweight championship bout between Demetrious Johnson and Chris Cariaso. Notably, this event marked the first time a UFC pay-per-view was headlined by a flyweight title fight. Johnson successfully defended his title, winning by submission in the second round.

Title: UFC 179: Aldo vs. Mendes 2
Description: UFC 179: Aldo vs. Mendes 2 was a mixed martial arts event held on October 25, 2014, at the Maracanãzinho Gymnasium in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. The main event featured a highly anticipated rematch between featherweight champion José Aldo and Chad Mendes. The fight ended with Aldo retaining his title via unanimous decision after an intense battle. This event showcased the thrilling rivalry between two top fighters in the featherweight division.

Title: UFC 18: The Road to the Heavyweight Title
Description: UFC 18: The Road to the Heavyweight Title was a mixed martial arts event held on January 8, 1999, at the Pontchartrain Center in New Orleans, Louisiana. The event featured a tournament to determine the number one contender for the UFC Heavyweight Championship, with Randy Couture emerging as the victor. Notable fights included Bas Rutten defending his UFC Heavyweight Championship against Tsuyoshi Kohsaka and Pat Miletich facing Jorge Patino.

Title: UFC 180: Werdum vs. Hunt
Description: UFC 180: Werdum vs. Hunt was a mixed martial arts event held on November 15, 2014, at the Arena Ciudad de México in Mexico City, Mexico. The main event featured a heavyweight title fight between Fabricio Werdum and Mark Hunt. This event was notable as the first UFC event held in Mexico and showcased the growing popularity of MMA in the country.

Title: UFC 181: Hendricks vs. Lawler II
Description: UFC 181: Hendricks vs. Lawler II was a mixed martial arts event held on December 6, 2014, at the Mandalay Bay Events Center in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a highly anticipated rematch between Johny Hendricks and Robbie Lawler for the UFC Welterweight Championship. The co-main event showcased a bantamweight title fight between TJ Dillashaw and Renan Barão. This event marked the first time in UFC history that both the welterweight and bantamweight titles were defended on the same card.

Title: UFC 182: Jones vs. Cormier
Description: UFC 182: Jones vs. Cormier was a mixed martial arts event held on January 3, 2015, at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a highly anticipated light heavyweight championship bout between Jon Jones and Daniel Cormier. This event marked the culmination of a heated rivalry between the two fighters, making it one of the most anticipated fights in UFC history.

Title: UFC 183: Silva vs. Diaz
Description: UFC 183: Silva vs. Diaz was a mixed martial arts event held on January 31, 2015, at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a highly anticipated middleweight bout between former champion Anderson Silva and Nick Diaz. This event marked Silva's return after a devastating leg injury. The fight ended in a unanimous decision victory for Silva.

Title: UFC 184: Rousey vs. Zingano
Description: UFC 184: Rousey vs. Zingano was a mixed martial arts event held on February 28, 2015, at the Staples Center in Los Angeles, California. The main event featured a women's bantamweight championship bout between Ronda Rousey and Cat Zingano. Rousey secured victory in just 14 seconds, setting a record for the fastest finish in UFC title fight history. This event marked the first time two women headlined a UFC pay-per-view event.

Title: UFC 185: Pettis vs. dos Anjos
Description: UFC 185: Pettis vs. dos Anjos was a mixed martial arts event held on March 14, 2015, at the American Airlines Center in Dallas, Texas. The main event featured a lightweight championship bout between Anthony Pettis and Rafael dos Anjos, with dos Anjos emerging victorious to become the new champion. Notable fights included Carla Esparza defending her strawweight title against Joanna Jędrzejczyk and Johny Hendricks facing Matt Brown in a welterweight clash.

Title: UFC 186: Johnson vs. Horiguchi
Description: UFC 186: Johnson vs. Horiguchi was a mixed martial arts event held on April 25, 2015, at the Bell Centre in Montreal, Quebec, Canada. The main event featured a flyweight championship bout between Demetrious Johnson and Kyoji Horiguchi. Notably, this event marked the first time a UFC pay-per-view event had no fights on the main card end in a finish.

Title: UFC 187: Johnson vs. Cormier
Description: UFC 187: Johnson vs. Cormier was a mixed martial arts event held on May 23, 2015, at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a highly anticipated bout between Demetrious Johnson and Daniel Cormier for the UFC Light Heavyweight Championship. Additionally, the card showcased a title fight between Chris Weidman and Vitor Belfort for the UFC Middleweight Championship.

Title: UFC 188: Velasquez vs. Werdum
Description: UFC 188: Velasquez vs. Werdum was a mixed martial arts event held on June 13, 2015, at the Arena Ciudad de México in Mexico City, Mexico. The main event featured a heavyweight title unification bout between Cain Velasquez and Fabricio Werdum. This event marked the first time the UFC held a pay-per-view event in Mexico. Werdum emerged victorious, becoming the undisputed UFC Heavyweight Champion.

Title: UFC 189: Mendes vs. McGregor
Description: UFC 189: Mendes vs. McGregor was a mixed martial arts event held on July 11, 2015, at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a highly anticipated featherweight title fight between Chad Mendes and Conor McGregor. This event gained significant attention due to the charismatic personalities and trash-talking between the two fighters, making it one of the most memorable events in UFC history.

Title: UFC 19: Ultimate Young Guns
Description: UFC 19: Ultimate Young Guns was held on March 5, 1999, at the Casino Magic in Bay St. Louis, Mississippi. This event showcased rising talents in the mixed martial arts world, featuring notable fighters such as Tito Ortiz, Chuck Liddell, and Matt Hughes. It marked the beginning of their successful careers, making it a pivotal event in UFC history.

Title: UFC 190: Rousey vs. Correia
Description: UFC 190: Rousey vs. Correia was a mixed martial arts event held on August 1, 2015, at the HSBC Arena in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. The main event featured a highly anticipated bantamweight title fight between Ronda Rousey and Bethe Correia. Rousey secured victory in just 34 seconds, defending her title and setting a new record for the fastest finish in UFC women's bantamweight history.

Title: UFC 191: Johnson vs. Dodson 2
Description: UFC 191: Johnson vs. Dodson 2 was a mixed martial arts event held on September 5, 2015, at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a flyweight championship rematch between Demetrious Johnson and John Dodson. This event marked the second time these two fighters faced each other, with Johnson successfully defending his title once again via unanimous decision.

Title: UFC 192: Cormier vs. Gustafsson
Description: UFC 192: Cormier vs. Gustafsson was a mixed martial arts event held on October 3, 2015, at the Toyota Center in Houston, Texas. The main event featured a thrilling light heavyweight championship bout between Daniel Cormier and Alexander Gustafsson. The event also showcased notable fights such as Ryan Bader vs. Rashad Evans and Joseph Benavidez vs. Ali Bagautinov. With a packed arena and intense matchups, UFC 192 delivered an unforgettable night of action.

Title: UFC 193: Rousey vs. Holm
Description: UFC 193: Rousey vs. Holm was a mixed martial arts event held on November 15, 2015, at the Etihad Stadium in Melbourne, Australia. The event featured a highly anticipated women's bantamweight championship bout between Ronda Rousey and Holly Holm. Holm shocked the world by delivering a stunning head kick knockout, ending Rousey's undefeated streak and becoming the new champion. The event set a record for the largest attendance in UFC history with over 56,000 spectators.

Title: UFC 194: Aldo vs. McGregor
Description: UFC 194: Aldo vs. McGregor was a mixed martial arts event held on December 12, 2015, at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a highly anticipated featherweight championship bout between José Aldo and Conor McGregor, which ended in just 13 seconds with McGregor claiming victory. This event also showcased a middleweight title fight between Chris Weidman and Luke Rockhold.

Title: UFC 195: Lawler vs. Condit
Description: UFC 195: Lawler vs. Condit was a mixed martial arts event held on January 2, 2016, at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a welterweight championship bout between Robbie Lawler and Carlos Condit, which Lawler won by split decision. The event also showcased thrilling fights such as Stipe Miocic vs. Andrei Arlovski and Albert Tumenov vs. Lorenz Larkin.

Title: UFC 196: McGregor vs. Diaz
Description: UFC 196: McGregor vs. Diaz was a mixed martial arts event held on March 5, 2016, at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured a highly anticipated welterweight bout between Conor McGregor and Nate Diaz. Diaz, a late replacement, shocked the world by submitting McGregor in the second round, marking a significant upset in UFC history.

Title: UFC 197: Jones vs. Saint Preux
Description: UFC 197: Jones vs. Saint Preux was a mixed martial arts event held on April 23, 2016, at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas, Nevada. The main event featured Jon Jones returning to the octagon after a suspension to face Ovince Saint Preux for the interim UFC Light Heavyweight Championship. This event marked the first time in UFC history that a champion was stripped of his title due to disciplinary reasons.

Title: UFC 198: Werdum vs. Miocic
Description: UFC 198: Werdum vs. Miocic was a mixed martial arts event held on May 14, 2016, at the Arena da Baixada in Curitiba, Brazil. The main event featured a heavyweight championship bout between Fabricio Werdum and Stipe Miocic. This event marked the first time the UFC held an event in Curitiba, the birthplace of Brazilian MMA. It also set a record for the largest attendance in UFC history with over 45,000 spectators.

Title: UFC 199: Rockhold vs. Bisping 2
Description: UFC 199: Rockhold vs. Bisping 2 was a mixed martial arts event held on June 4, 2016, at The Forum in Inglewood, California. The main event featured a highly anticipated rematch between Luke Rockhold and Michael Bisping for the UFC Middleweight Championship. Bisping shocked the world by knocking out Rockhold in the first round, becoming the first British fighter to win a UFC title.

Title: UFC 2: No Way Out
Description: UFC 2: No Way Out was a mixed martial arts event held on March 11, 1994, at the Mammoth Gardens in Denver, Colorado. This historic event featured an eight-man tournament with no weight classes or time limits, showcasing the early days of the UFC. The main event saw Royce Gracie successfully defend his title, solidifying his dominance in the sport.

Title: UFC 20: Battle for the Gold
Description: UFC 20: Battle for the Gold was a mixed martial arts event held on May 7, 1999, at the Boutwell Memorial Auditorium in Birmingham, Alabama. The event featured a highly anticipated heavyweight championship bout between Bas Rutten and Kevin Randleman, with Rutten emerging victorious. This event marked the first time the UFC held a show in Alabama, showcasing the organization's growing popularity and expansion.

Title: UFC 200: Tate vs. Nunes
Description: UFC 200: Tate vs. Nunes was a mixed martial arts event held on July 9, 2016, at the T-Mobile Arena in Paradise, Nevada. The main event featured Miesha Tate defending her UFC Women's Bantamweight Championship against Amanda Nunes. This event marked the historic 200th numbered UFC event and showcased a stacked card with notable fighters such as Brock Lesnar, Anderson Silva, and Jose Aldo.

Title: UFC 201: Lawler vs. Woodley
Description: UFC 201: Lawler vs. Woodley was a mixed martial arts event held on July 30, 2016, at the Philips Arena in Atlanta, Georgia. The main event featured a welterweight championship bout between Robbie Lawler and Tyron Woodley, with Woodley emerging victorious to become the new champion. Notably, this event marked Lawler's third title defense and Woodley's first shot at the welterweight title.

Title: UFC 202: Diaz vs. McGregor 2
Description: UFC 202: Diaz vs. McGregor 2 was a mixed martial arts event held on August 20, 2016, at the T-Mobile Arena in Paradise, Nevada. The main event featured a highly anticipated rematch between Conor McGregor and Nate Diaz in the welterweight division. The event drew significant attention due to the intense rivalry between the two fighters and ended with McGregor winning by majority decision after a thrilling five-round battle.

Title: UFC 203: Miocic vs. Overeem
Description: UFC 203: Miocic vs. Overeem was a mixed martial arts event held on September 10, 2016, at the Quicken Loans Arena in Cleveland, Ohio. The main event featured a heavyweight championship bout between Stipe Miocic and Alistair Overeem. Notably, this event marked the first time the UFC held an event in Cleveland, Miocic's hometown. Miocic successfully defended his title, winning by knockout in the first round.

Title: UFC 204: Bisping vs. Henderson 2
Description: UFC 204: Bisping vs. Henderson 2 was a mixed martial arts event held on October 8, 2016, at the Manchester Arena in Manchester, England. The main event featured a highly anticipated rematch between Michael Bisping and Dan Henderson for the UFC Middleweight Championship. Henderson had previously defeated Bisping in a legendary knockout at UFC 100. This event marked the first time a UFC pay-per-view event was held in Manchester.

Title: UFC 205: Alvarez vs. McGregor
Description: UFC 205: Alvarez vs. McGregor was a historic mixed martial arts event held on November 12, 2016, at Madison Square Garden in New York City. It marked the first time the UFC hosted an event in New York since the state legalized professional MMA. The main event featured a clash between Eddie Alvarez and Conor McGregor for the UFC Lightweight Championship, with McGregor becoming the first fighter to hold two titles simultaneously in different weight classes.

Title: UFC 206: Holloway vs. Pettis
Description: UFC 206: Holloway vs. Pettis was a mixed martial arts event held on December 10, 2016, at the Air Canada Centre in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. The main event featured a thrilling featherweight title fight between Max Holloway and Anthony Pettis. Notably, this event marked the first time in UFC history that a non-title fight was elevated to the main event due to a title fight cancellation.

Title: UFC 207: Nunes vs. Rousey
Description: UFC 207: Nunes vs. Rousey was a mixed martial arts event held on December 30, 2016, at the T-Mobile Arena in Paradise, Nevada. The main event featured a highly anticipated women's bantamweight championship bout between Amanda Nunes and Ronda Rousey. Nunes emerged victorious, stunning the world with a first-round TKO victory over the former champion. This event marked Rousey's return to the octagon after over a year of absence.

Title: UFC 208: Holm vs. de Randamie
Description: UFC 208: Holm vs. de Randamie was a mixed martial arts event held on February 11, 2017, at the Barclays Center in Brooklyn, New York. The main event featured a historic women's featherweight title fight between former bantamweight champion Holly Holm and Germaine de Randamie. This event marked the first time the UFC introduced the women's featherweight division.

Title: UFC 209: Woodley vs. Thompson 2
Description: UFC 209: Woodley vs. Thompson 2 was a mixed martial arts event held on March 4, 2017, at the T-Mobile Arena in Paradise, Nevada. The main event featured a highly anticipated rematch between welterweight champion Tyron Woodley and Stephen Thompson. The co-main event showcased a lightweight bout between Khabib Nurmagomedov and Tony Ferguson. This event marked the second meeting between Woodley and Thompson, following their draw at UFC 205.

Title: UFC 21: Return of the Champions
Description: UFC 21: Return of the Champions was held on July 16, 1999, at the Five Seasons Events Center in Cedar Rapids, Iowa. This event featured a highly anticipated rematch between Ken Shamrock and Tito Ortiz for the UFC Light Heavyweight Championship. Additionally, the card showcased notable fighters such as Pat Miletich, Pedro Rizzo, and Mark Coleman. The event marked the return of several former UFC champions, making it a memorable night for MMA fans.

Title: UFC 210: Cormier vs. Johnson 2
Description: UFC 210: Cormier vs. Johnson 2 was a mixed martial arts event held on April 8, 2017, at the KeyBank Center in Buffalo, New York. The main event featured a rematch between Daniel Cormier and Anthony Johnson for the UFC Light Heavyweight Championship. Notably, Cormier successfully defended his title by submitting Johnson in the second round. The event also showcased other exciting matchups, making it a memorable night for MMA fans.

Title: UFC 211: Miocic vs. dos Santos 2
Description: UFC 211: Miocic vs. dos Santos 2 was a mixed martial arts event held on May 13, 2017, at the American Airlines Center in Dallas, Texas. The main event featured a rematch between Stipe Miocic and Junior dos Santos for the UFC Heavyweight Championship. Notable fights included Joanna Jędrzejczyk defending her Women's Strawweight title against Jéssica Andrade and Demian Maia facing Jorge Masvidal in a welterweight bout.

Title: UFC 212: Aldo vs. Holloway
Description: UFC 212: Aldo vs. Holloway was a mixed martial arts event held on June 3, 2017, at the Jeunesse Arena in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. The main event featured a featherweight title unification bout between José Aldo and Max Holloway. This event marked the first time that the UFC Featherweight Championship was unified since Conor McGregor held both titles. Holloway emerged victorious, becoming the undisputed featherweight champion.

Title: UFC 213: Romero vs. Whittaker
Description: UFC 213: Romero vs. Whittaker was a mixed martial arts event held on July 8, 2017, at the T-Mobile Arena in Paradise, Nevada. The main event featured a thrilling battle between Yoel Romero and Robert Whittaker for the interim UFC Middleweight Championship. Additionally, the card showcased a women's bantamweight title fight between Amanda Nunes and Valentina Shevchenko. This event marked the first time the UFC held an event on the weekend of the International Fight Week without a championship bout.

Title: UFC 214: Cormier vs. Jones 2
Description: UFC 214: Cormier vs. Jones 2 was a mixed martial arts event held on July 29, 2017, at the Honda Center in Anaheim, California. The main event featured a highly anticipated rematch between Daniel Cormier and Jon Jones for the UFC Light Heavyweight Championship. Jones emerged victorious, reclaiming the title after a third-round knockout. The event also showcased other notable fights, including a welterweight clash between Tyron Woodley and Demian Maia.

Title: UFC 215: Nunes vs. Shevchenko 2
Description: UFC 215: Nunes vs. Shevchenko 2 was a mixed martial arts event held on September 9, 2017, at Rogers Place in Edmonton, Alberta, Canada. The main event featured a highly anticipated rematch between Amanda Nunes and Valentina Shevchenko for the UFC Women's Bantamweight Championship. Notably, this event marked the first time a UFC pay-per-view event was held in Edmonton.

Title: UFC 216: Ferguson vs. Lee
Description: UFC 216: Ferguson vs. Lee was a mixed martial arts event held on October 7, 2017, at the T-Mobile Arena in Paradise, Nevada. The main event featured a lightweight championship bout between Tony Ferguson and Kevin Lee. Notably, this event marked the return of heavyweight fighter Fabricio Werdum. Additionally, it was the first UFC event held in Las Vegas following the tragic shooting at the Route 91 Harvest music festival.

Title: UFC 217: Bisping vs. St-Pierre
Description: UFC 217: Bisping vs. St-Pierre was a mixed martial arts event held on November 4, 2017, at Madison Square Garden in New York City. The main event featured a highly anticipated middleweight championship bout between Michael Bisping and Georges St-Pierre, marking St-Pierre's return after a four-year hiatus. This event also showcased two other title fights, including Cody Garbrandt vs. T.J. Dillashaw for the bantamweight title and Joanna Jędrzejczyk vs. Rose Namajunas for the strawweight title.

Title: UFC 218: Holloway vs. Aldo 2
Description: UFC 218: Holloway vs. Aldo 2 was a mixed martial arts event held on December 2, 2017, at the Little Caesars Arena in Detroit, Michigan. The main event featured a rematch between Max Holloway and José Aldo for the UFC Featherweight Championship. Notably, Holloway successfully defended his title, defeating Aldo via TKO in the third round. The event also showcased other thrilling fights, making it a memorable night for MMA fans.

Title: UFC 219: Cyborg vs. Holm
Description: UFC 219: Cyborg vs. Holm was a mixed martial arts event held on December 30, 2017, at the T-Mobile Arena in Paradise, Nevada, United States. The main event featured a highly anticipated clash between Cris Cyborg and Holly Holm for the UFC Women's Featherweight Championship. This event marked the first time Cyborg defended her title. Notably, Khabib Nurmagomedov also showcased his dominance with a dominant victory over Edson Barboza.

Title: UFC 22: Only One Can be Champion
Description: UFC 22: Only One Can be Champion was a mixed martial arts event held on September 24, 1999, at the Lake Charles Civic Center in Lake Charles, Louisiana. The main event featured a heavyweight championship bout between Maurice Smith and Tank Abbott, with Smith emerging victorious. This event also showcased notable fighters such as Tito Ortiz, Frank Shamrock, and Pat Miletich, making it a memorable night for MMA fans.

Title: UFC 220: Miocic vs. Ngannou
Description: UFC 220: Miocic vs. Ngannou was a mixed martial arts event held on January 20, 2018, at the TD Garden in Boston, Massachusetts. The main event featured a heavyweight championship bout between Stipe Miocic and Francis Ngannou. Miocic successfully defended his title, showcasing his superior grappling skills against Ngannou's knockout power. The event also included a co-main event between Daniel Cormier and Volkan Oezdemir for the light heavyweight championship.

Title: UFC 221: Romero vs. Rockhold
Description: UFC 221: Romero vs. Rockhold was a mixed martial arts event held on February 10, 2018, at the Perth Arena in Perth, Australia. The main event featured a middleweight bout between Yoel Romero and Luke Rockhold for the interim UFC Middleweight Championship. Notably, this was the first UFC event held in Western Australia.

Title: UFC 222: Cyborg vs. Kunitskaya
Description: UFC 222: Cyborg vs. Kunitskaya was a mixed martial arts event held on March 3, 2018, at the T-Mobile Arena in Paradise, Nevada. The main event featured a women's featherweight championship bout between Cris Cyborg and Yana Kunitskaya. Notably, Brian Ortega secured a stunning knockout victory against Frankie Edgar in the co-main event. This event marked Cyborg's second successful title defense.

Title: UFC 223: Khabib vs. Iaquinta
Description: UFC 223: Khabib vs. Iaquinta was a mixed martial arts event held on April 7, 2018, at the Barclays Center in Brooklyn, New York. The main event featured a lightweight championship bout between Khabib Nurmagomedov and Al Iaquinta. This event was notable for its last-minute changes, as it originally scheduled Tony Ferguson vs. Nurmagomedov, but Ferguson withdrew due to injury.

Title: UFC 224: Nunes vs. Pennington
Description: UFC 224: Nunes vs. Pennington was a mixed martial arts event held on May 12, 2018, at the Jeunesse Arena in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. The main event featured a women's bantamweight championship bout between Amanda Nunes and Raquel Pennington. Notably, Nunes successfully defended her title, winning by TKO in the fifth round. The event also showcased other exciting fights, making it a memorable night for MMA fans.

Title: UFC 225: Whittaker vs. Romero 2
Description: UFC 225: Whittaker vs. Romero 2 was a mixed martial arts event held on June 9, 2018, at the United Center in Chicago, Illinois. The main event featured a highly anticipated rematch between Robert Whittaker and Yoel Romero for the UFC Middleweight Championship. The event also showcased other notable fights, including Rafael dos Anjos vs. Colby Covington for the interim UFC Welterweight Championship.

Title: UFC 226: Miocic vs. Cormier
Description: UFC 226: Miocic vs. Cormier was a mixed martial arts event held on July 7, 2018, at the T-Mobile Arena in Paradise, Nevada. The main event featured a superfight between heavyweight champion Stipe Miocic and light heavyweight champion Daniel Cormier. Cormier made history by becoming the second fighter to hold titles in two weight classes simultaneously. The event also showcased a thrilling featherweight bout between Max Holloway and Brian Ortega.

Title: UFC 227: Dillashaw vs. Garbrandt 2
Description: UFC 227: Dillashaw vs. Garbrandt 2 was a mixed martial arts event held on August 4, 2018, at the Staples Center in Los Angeles, California. The main event featured a bantamweight championship rematch between TJ Dillashaw and Cody Garbrandt. Additionally, the co-main event showcased a flyweight title fight between Demetrious Johnson and Henry Cejudo. This event marked the second meeting between Dillashaw and Garbrandt, with Dillashaw emerging victorious once again.

Title: UFC 228: Woodley vs. Till
Description: UFC 228: Woodley vs. Till was a mixed martial arts event held on September 8, 2018, at the American Airlines Center in Dallas, Texas. The main event featured a welterweight championship bout between Tyron Woodley and Darren Till. Woodley successfully defended his title, submitting Till in the second round.
